Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different types of land habitats such as playgrounds, gardens, forests, or parking lots.
The student can draw and label different types of water habitats such as ponds, streams, or lakes.
The student can illustrate and label various plants and animals within these habitats, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show patterns by comparing the different types of living things found in each habitat.
The student can demonstrate through drawings how certain plants and animals are unique to specific habitats.
The student can organize their drawings to clearly show the diversity of life in each habitat.
